title: Hand-on Exercise 1
text:
The code chunk below uses p_load() of pacman package to check if tidyverse packages are installed in the computer. If they are, then they will be launched into R.

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)





exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")

Rows: 322 Columns: 7
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (4): ID, CLASS, GENDER, RACE
dbl (3): ENGLISH, MATHS, SCIENCE

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

title: Hand-on Exercise 1
text:
The code chunk below uses p_load() of pacman package to check if tidyverse packages are installed in the computer. If they are, then they will be launched into R.

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)

title: Hand-on Exercise 1
text:
exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")

Rows: 322 Columns: 7
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (4): ID, CLASS, GENDER, RACE
dbl (3): ENGLISH, MATHS, SCIENCE

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

title: Hand-on Exercise 1
text:
R Graphics VS ggplot

hist(exam_data$MATHS)









ggplot(data=exam_data, aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=10, 
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="yellow", 
                 fill="red") +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores")

title: Hand-on Exercise 1
section: Essential Grammatical Elements in ggplot2: data
text:
Essential Grammatical Elements in ggplot2: data

ggplot(data=exam_data)

title: Hand-on Exercise 1
section: Essential Grammatical Elements in ggplot2: Aesthetic mappings
text:
Essential Grammatical Elements in ggplot2: Aesthetic mappings

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS))

title: Hand-on Exercise 1
text:
Geometric Objects: geom_bar

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar()

title: Hand-on Exercise 1
text:
Geometric Objects: geom_dotplot

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_dotplot(dotsize = 0.5)

Bin width defaults to 1/30 of the range of the data. Pick better value with
`binwidth`.










ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_dotplot(binwidth=2.5,         
               dotsize = 0.5) +      
  scale_y_continuous(NULL,           
                     breaks = NULL)

title: Hand-on Exercise 1
text:
Geometric Objects: geom_histogram()

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram()       

`stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.

title: Hand-on Exercise 1
section: Modifying a geometric object by changing geom()
text:
Modifying a geometric object by changing geom()

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20,            
                 color="black",      
                 fill="light blue")

title: Hand-on Exercise 1
section: Modifying a geometric object by changing aes()
text:
Modifying a geometric object by changing aes()

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, 
           fill = GENDER)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 color="grey30")

title: Hand-on Exercise 1
text:
Geometric Objects: geom-density()

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_density()           









ggplot(data=exam_data,
       aes(x=MATHS,
          color = GENDER)) +
  geom_density()

title: Hand-on Exercise 1
text:
Geometric Objects: geom_boxplot

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(y = MATHS,
           x = GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot()









ggplot(data=exam_data,
       aes(y=MATHS,
           x=GENDER))+
  geom_boxplot(notch = TRUE)

title: Hand-on Exercise 1
text:
Geometric Objects: geom_violin

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(y = MATHS, 
           x= GENDER)) +
  geom_violin()

title: Hand-on Exercise 1
text:
Geometric Objects: geom_point()

ggplot(data=exam_data,
       aes(y=MATHS,
           x=ENGLISH))+
  geom_point()

title: Hand-on Exercise 1
text:
geom objects can be combined

ggplot(data=exam_data,
       aes(y=MATHS,
           x=GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  geom_point(position = "jitter",
             size=0.5)

title: Hand-on Exercise 1
text:
Working with stat()

ggplot(data=exam_data,
       aes(y=MATHS,x=GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot()

title: Hand-on Exercise 1
section: Working with stat - the stat_summary() method
text:
Working with stat - the stat_summary() method

ggplot(data=exam_data,
       aes(y=MATHS,
           x=GENDER))+
  geom_boxplot() +
  stat_summary(geom = "point",
               fun = "mean",
               colour="red",
               size=4)

title: Hand-on Exercise 1
section: Working with stat - the geom() method
text:
Working with stat - the geom() method

ggplot(data=exam_data,
       aes(y=MATHS,
           x=GENDER)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  geom_point(stat="summary",
             fun="mean",
             colour="red",
             size=4)

title: Hand-on Exercise 1
section: Adding a best fit curve on a scatterplot
text:
Adding a best fit curve on a scatterplot

ggplot(data=exam_data,
       aes(y=MATHS,
           x=ENGLISH))+
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(size=0.5)

Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0.
ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead.


`geom_smooth()` using method = 'loess' and formula = 'y ~ x'










ggplot(data=exam_data,
       aes(y=MATHS,
           x=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point()+
  geom_smooth(method = lm,
              size=0.5)

`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'

title: Hand-on Exercise 1
text:
Working with facet_wrap()

ggplot(data=exam_data,
       aes(x=MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20) +
  facet_wrap(~ CLASS)

title: Hand-on Exercise 1
text:
facet_grid() function

ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x=MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20) +
  facet_grid(~ CLASS)

title: Hand-on Exercise 1
text:
Working with Coordinate

ggplot(data= exam_data,
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar()









ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip()

title: Hand-on Exercise 1
section: Changing the y- and x-axis range
text:
Changing the y- and x-axis range

ggplot(data=exam_data,
       aes(x=MATHS,y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point()+
  geom_smooth(method = lm, size=0.5)

`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'










ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x= MATHS, y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method=lm, 
              size=0.5) +  
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100),
                  ylim=c(0,100))

`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'

title: Hand-on Exercise 1
text:
Working with theme

ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip() +
  theme_gray()









ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip() +
  theme_classic()









ggplot(data=exam_data, 
       aes(x=RACE)) +
  geom_bar() +
  coord_flip() +
  theme_minimal()

title: isss608-yuquan
text: Welcome to ISSS608 Visual Analytics and Applications. In this website, you will find my coursework prepared for this course.
